About

Hello, welcome to visit my site! üëã

I am currently a final year M.Sc. student in the Department of Computer Science at University of Amsterdam and Vrije University Amsterdam . My research interests lie primarily in the area of AI ‚à© CL ‚à© SE, such as Natural Language Processing, Understanding and Generation.

I just finished my master thesis under the supervision of Prof. Khalil Sima'an at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation, University of Amsterdam. The research topic of my master thesis is how to incorporate dependency probability distributions to help (self-) attention mechanism in Transformer-based model to better pay attention to the syntax relationship between the tokens of input sentences in the Neural Machine Translation (NMT) tasks.

In my free time, I enjoy doing sports (mostly jogging üèÉ and table tennis üèì ), traveling, and cooking ü•¢. Yes, I am very good at cooking Chinese food. Also, I used to be a writer, I like to write poems, novels and lyrics for songs, feel free to click here to listen to the songs I wrote.
